questiontext.text:
The Maclaurin expansion for sin($$\small\theta$$) provides a "small angle" approximation: sin($$\small\theta$$) $$\small\approx$$ $$\small\theta$$.
What is the smallest positive angle at which this approximation gives and error of 8$$\small\%$$
Express your answer to the nearest degree.

Answer :
{1:NUMERICAL:=39:1#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
The error for $$\small \theta$$ is given by :

=> $$\small \frac{| Expected Value - Approximate Value |}{Expected Value}$$ x 100%
=> $$\small \frac{sin(\theta) - \theta}{sin(\theta)}$$ x 100%

Trying with various numbers, you can approximate the solution  8% at $$\small \theta$$ $$\small \approx$$ 0.6737 radians or about 38.6 degrees.
Smallest positive angle = 39 degrees.
